name: Categorizing Information into Hierarchies
description: This task involves organizing information into hierarchical structures based on relationships, properties, or other logical criteria. It evaluates the model's ability to recognize patterns, understand relationships between concepts, and create meaningful categorizations.

examples.input:
Categorize the following animals into a hierarchical structure:
Lion, Sparrow, Salmon, Eagle, Shark, Trout, Tiger, Robin, Tuna
examples.output:
Animals
├── Mammals
│   ├── Felines
│   │   ├── Lion
│   │   └── Tiger
├── Birds
│   ├── Birds of Prey
│   │   └── Eagle
│   └── Songbirds
│       ├── Sparrow
│       └── Robin
└── Fish
    ├── Cartilaginous Fish
    │   └── Shark
    └── Bony Fish
        ├── Salmon
        └── Trout
        └── Tuna

examples.input:
Create a hierarchical categorization for the following programming concepts:
Variables, For Loop, If-Else Statement, Integer, String, While Loop, Boolean, Float, Switch Statement
examples.output:
Programming Concepts
├── Data Types
│   ├── Primitive Types
│   │   ├── Integer
│   │   ├── Float
│   │   └── Boolean
│   └── Reference Types
│       └── String
├── Control Structures
│   ├── Conditional Statements
│   │   ├── If-Else Statement
│   │   └── Switch Statement
│   └── Loops
│       ├── For Loop
│       └── While Loop
└── Variables
